cards.name: Akron Legionnaire
cards.text: Except for creatures named Akron Legionnaire and artifact creatures, creatures you control can't attack.

cards.flavor:
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."
—D'Avenant proverb
cards.name: Alabaster Potion
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.
cards.name: Amrou Kithkin
cards.text: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.

cards.name: Call to Arms
cards.text:
As Call to Arms enters the battlefield, choose a color and an opponent.
White creatures get +1/+1 as long as the chosen color is the most common color among nontoken permanents the chosen player controls but isn't tied for most common.
When the chosen color isn't the most common color among nontoken permanents the chosen player controls or is tied for most common, sacrifice Call to Arms.

cards.flavor: The clouds broke and the sun's rays burst forth; each foul beast in its turn faltered, and was gone.
cards.name: Cleanse
cards.text: Destroy all black creatures.

cards.flavor: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.
cards.name: D'Avenant Archer
cards.text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Divine Intervention
cards.text:
Divine Intervention enters the battlefield with two intervention counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an intervention counter from Divine Intervention.
When you remove the last intervention counter from Divine Intervention, the game is a draw.

cards.name: Eightfold Maze
cards.text:
Cast Eightfold Maze only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.flavor: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.
cards.name: Exorcist
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.

cards.flavor:
"All warfare is based on deception."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)
cards.name: False Defeat
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

cards.flavor: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse;/ With dragon blade he took each pass by force."
cards.name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest
cards.name: Heal
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor: The elite guard of the Mesa High Priests, the Ivory Guardians, were created to protect the innocent and faithful. Some say their actions are above the law.
cards.name: Ivory Guardians
cards.text:
Protection from red
Creatures named Ivory Guardians get +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken red permanent.

cards.flavor: "Such a lord as this—all virtues' height—Had never been, nor ever was again."
cards.name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"
cards.text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Land Tax
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"If you do it right, they'll never know what hit them."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.name: Lightning Blow
cards.text:
Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."
—Liu Bei
cards.name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.

cards.name: Loyal Retainers
cards.text: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.flavor: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.
cards.name: Misfortune's Gain
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

cards.flavor:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood. . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath
cards.name: Peach Garden Oath
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.

cards.flavor: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.
cards.name: Shu Cavalry
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.flavor: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."
cards.name: Shu Elite Companions
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.name: Shu General
cards.text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.flavor: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.
cards.name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
cards.text: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: As many attackers were dazzled by the wall's beauty as were halted by its force.
cards.name: Wall of Light
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from black

cards.flavor: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.
cards.name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
cards.text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.flavor: The rising oceans brought new lakes—and new terrors—to Terisiare. The Explorers found their ancient enemies spawning everywhere.
cards.name: Benthic Explorers
cards.text: {T}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return."
—William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second
cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.
cards.name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

cards.flavor: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."
cards.name: Brilliant Plan
cards.text: Draw three cards.

cards.flavor: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.
cards.name: Capture of Jingzhou
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Dance of Many
cards.text:
When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, put a token that's a copy of target nontoken creature onto the battlefield.
When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the token.
When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.

cards.flavor: Many people say that no power can bring the mountains low. Many people are fools.
cards.name: Flash Flood
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target red permanent.
• Return target Mountain to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Force Spike
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.flavor:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu
cards.name: Forced Retreat
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor:
"The potential for change lies in all things. Know a thing's nature, know its possibilities, and know it anew."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Royal Mage
cards.name: Infuse
cards.text:
Untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then again, we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
cards.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
cards.text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Land Equilibrium
cards.text: If an opponent who controls at least as many lands as you do would put a land onto the battlefield, that player instead puts that land onto the battlefield then sacrifices a land.

cards.flavor: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.
cards.name: Lu Meng, Wu General
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.name: Lu Xun, Scholar General
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Mana Drain
cards.text: Counter target spell. At the beginning of your next main phase, add {X} to your mana pool, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Mana Vortex
cards.text:
When you cast Mana Vortex, counter it unless you sacrifice a land.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land.
When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.

cards.name: Old Man of the Sea
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Old Man of the Sea during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power for as long as Old Man of the Sea remains tapped and that creature's power remains less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power.

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

cards.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then felt lifeless to the ground.
cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Reset
cards.text:
Cast Reset only during an opponent's turn after his or her upkeep step.
Untap all lands you control.

cards.flavor:
"It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"
—Halina, Dwarven Trader
cards.name: Reveka, Wizard Savant
cards.text: {T}: Reveka, Wizard Savant deals 2 damage to target creature or player and doesn't untap during your next untap step.

cards.name: Spiny Starfish
cards.text:
{U}: Regenerate Spiny Starfish.
At the beginning of each end step, if Spiny Starfish regenerated this turn, put a 0/1 blue Starfish creature token onto the battlefield for each time it regenerated this turn.

cards.flavor: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."
cards.name: Strategic Planning
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Sun Ce, Young Conquerer
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Sun Ce, Young Conquerer enters the battlefield, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."
cards.name: Sun Quan, Lord of Wu
cards.text: Creatures you control have horsemanship. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.flavor: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.
cards.name: Wu Elite Cavalry
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.name: Wu Longbowman
cards.text: {T}: Wu Longbowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.flavor: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.
cards.name: Wu Warship
cards.text: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: All Hallow's Eve
cards.text:
Exile All Hallow's Eve with two scream counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if All Hallow's Eve is exiled with a scream counter on it, remove a scream counter from it. If there are no more scream counters on it, put it into your graveyard and each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Ashes to Ashes
cards.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.

cards.flavor: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.
cards.name: Banshee
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to target creature or player, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.

cards.flavor:
"‘War is no picnic,' my father liked to say. But the ants seemed to disagree."
—General Chanek Valteroth
cards.name: Carrion Ants
cards.text: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Then flashed the living lightning from her eyes,/ And screams of horror rend th' affrighted skies."
—Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock
cards.name: Cosmic Horror
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Cosmic Horror unless you pay {3}{B}{B}{B}. If Cosmic Horror is destroyed this way, it deals 7 damage to you.

cards.name: Demonic Torment
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."
cards.name: Desperate Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Evil Presence
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

cards.flavor: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."
cards.name: Famine
cards.text: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor:
"The burst of strength brought on by this plague should not be mistaken for a sign of renewed health."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid
cards.name: Fevered Strength
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.
cards.name: Ghostly Visit
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: The voices of the dead ring in the heart long after they have faded from the ears.
cards.name: Ghosts of the Damned
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
One who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb
cards.name: Grim Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library. You lose 3 life.

cards.flavor: "High on a throne of royal state . . . insatiate to pursue vain war with heav'n." —John Milton, Paradise Lost
cards.name: Hellfire
cards.text: Destroy all nonblack creatures. Hellfire deals X plus 3 damage to you, where X is the number of creatures that died this way.

cards.name: Lesser Werewolf
cards.text: {B}: If Lesser Werewolf's power is 1 or more, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn and put a -0/-1 counter on target creature blocking or blocked by Lesser Werewolf. Activate this ability only during the declare blockers step.

cards.name: Mind Twist
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

cards.flavor: These days, some wizards are finding that they have a little too much spell left at the end of their mana.
cards.name: Nether Void
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, counter it unless that player pays {3}.

cards.name: Spirit Shackle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, put a -0/-2 counter on it.

cards.flavor: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.
cards.name: Stolen Grain
cards.text: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent. You gain 5 life.

cards.name: Takklemaggot
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller chooses a creature that Takklemaggot could enchant. If he or she does, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control attached to that creature. If he or she doesn't, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control as a non-Aura enchantment. It loses "enchant creature" and gains "At the beginning of that player's upkeep, Takklemaggot deals 1 damage to him or her."

cards.flavor: "An immense river of oblivion is sweeping us away into a nameless abyss." —Ernest Renan, Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse
cards.name: The Abyss
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, destroy target nonartifact creature that player controls of his or her choice. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: The Wretched
cards.text: At end of combat, gain control of all creatures blocking The Wretched for as long as you control The Wretched.

cards.flavor: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.
cards.name: Wei Elite Companions
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.flavor: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.
cards.name: Wei Infantry
Wei Night Raiders
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Wei Night Raiders deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card.

cards.flavor: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.
cards.name: Wei Strike Force
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.name: Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Sacrifice Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed: Return target black card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.flavor:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)
cards.name: Young Wei Recruits
cards.text: Young Wei Recruits can't block.

cards.name: Active Volcano
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target blue permanent.
• Return target Island to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"The Ancestors are the wisdom of the tribe and the soul of the Homelands. I am eternally in their debt."
—Taysir
cards.name: Anaba Ancestor
cards.text: {T}: Another target Minotaur creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The Spirit Crafters sing of all our people. They sing of those lost, of those found, and of those who are yet to be."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
cards.name: Anaba Spirit Crafter
cards.text: Minotaur creatures get +1/+0.

cards.name: Blood Lust
cards.text: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

cards.name: Burning of Xinye
cards.text: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.flavor: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?
cards.name: Cinder Storm
cards.text: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Corrupt Eunuchs
cards.text: When Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Kobolds are harmless."
—Bearand the Bold, epitaph
cards.name: Crimson Kobolds

cards.flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.
cards.name: Crimson Manticore
cards.text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Disharmony
cards.text:
Cast Disharmony only during combat before blockers are declared.
Untap target attacking creature and remove it from combat. Gain control of that creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Dong Zhou, the Tyrant
cards.text: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.

cards.flavor: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."
cards.name: Fire Ambush
cards.text: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Brimstone marks this drake's territory. Unfortunately for travelers, all of the Burning Isles smell likewise.
cards.name: Fire Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor:
"The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,/ Her ashes new-create another heir/ As great in admiration as herself."
—William Shakespeare, King Henry the Eighth.
cards.name: Firestorm Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
If Firestorm Phoenix would die, return Firestorm Phoenix to its owner's hand instead. Until that player's next turn, that player plays with that card revealed in his or her hand and can't play it.

cards.name: Forked Lightning
cards.text: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.

cards.flavor: The frost giants have been out in the cold a long, long time, but they have their rage to keep them warm.
cards.name: Frost Giant
cards.text: Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.flavor: The minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.
cards.name: Hurloon Minotaur
Immolation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.

cards.flavor: "Joining this army is easy, boy. Just survive your first battle."
cards.name: Kobold Drill Sergeant
cards.text: Other Kobold creatures you control get +0/+1 and have trample.

cards.flavor: "One for all, all for one; we strike first, and then you're done!" —Oath of the Kobold Musketeers
cards.name: Kobold Overlord
cards.text:
First strike
Other Kobold creatures you control have first strike.

cards.flavor: The Taskmaster knows that there is no cure for the common Kobold.
cards.name: Kobold Taskmaster
cards.text: Other Kobold creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.flavor: Kher Keep is unique among fortresses: impervious to aerial assault but defenseless from the ground.
cards.name: Kobolds of Kher Keep

cards.flavor: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer,/ Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."
cards.name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
cards.text: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.
cards.name: Raging Minotaur
cards.text: Haste

cards.name: Rolling Earthquake
cards.text: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.

cards.name: Storm World
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Storm World deals X damage to that player, where X is 4 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.

cards.flavor: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream,/ For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."
cards.name: Zodiac Dragon
cards.text: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return it to your hand.

cards.name: Arboria
cards.text: Creatures can't attack a player unless that player cast a spell or put a nontoken permanent onto the battlefield during his or her last turn.

cards.name: Concordant Crossroads
cards.text: All creatures have haste.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.

cards.flavor:
They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out."
—Ailheen, Speaker of the Council
cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.

cards.flavor:
"Faeries talk all in riddles and tricky bits, ‘cept the Nobles. Now, there's some straight talkers."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable
cards.name: Faerie Noble
cards.text:
Flying
Other Faerie creatures you control get +0/+1.
{T}: Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fire Sprites
cards.text:
Flying
{G}, {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Freyalise's Winds
cards.text:
Whenever a permanent becomes tapped, put a wind counter on it.
If a permanent with a wind counter on it would untap during its controller's untap step, remove all wind counters from it instead.

cards.name: Gaea's Touch
cards.text:
{0}: You may put a basic Forest card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.
Sacrifice Gaea's Touch: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Heavy Fog
cards.text:
Cast Heavy Fog only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

cards.name: Hua Tuo, Honored Physician
cards.text: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Hunting Cheetah
cards.text: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The lion's only loyalty is to its hunger.
cards.name: Jungle Lion
cards.text: Jungle Lion can't block.

cards.flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.
cards.name: Killer Bees
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Living Plane
cards.text: All lands are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.flavor: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.
cards.name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
cards.text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.
cards.name: Meng Huo's Horde
Reincarnation
cards.text: Choose target creature. When that creature dies this turn, return a creature card from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield under the control of that creature's owner.

cards.flavor:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the Dilu brings its master ill fortune
cards.name: Riding the Dilu Horse
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the scryb were very funny anymore.
cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)
cards.name: Slashing Tiger
cards.text: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spoils of Victory
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."
—Mencius, a Chinese philosopher
cards.name: Three Visits
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Tracker
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Tracker deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tracker.

cards.flavor: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.
cards.name: Trip Wire
cards.text: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.

cards.flavor:
"Those of faith are those of strength."
—Autumn Willow
cards.name: Willow Priestess
cards.text:
{T}: You may put a Faerie permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
{2}{G}: Target green creature gains protection from black until end of turn.

cards.name: Willow Satyr
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Willow Satyr during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target legendary creature for as long as you control Willow Satyr and Willow Satyr remains tapped.

cards.name: Wormwood Treefolk
cards.text:
{G}{G}: Wormwood Treefolk gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{B}{B}: Wormwood Treefolk gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: "Battles no longer served a purpose in Karakas." —Angus Mackenzie, Diary
cards.name: Angus Mackenzie
cards.text: {G}{W}{U}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Activate this ability only before the combat damage step.

cards.name: Arcades Sabboth
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Arcades Sabboth unless you pay {G}{W}{U}.
Each untapped creature you control gets +0/+2 as long as it's not attacking.
{W}: Arcades Sabboth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Axelrod Gunnarson
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Axelrod Gunnarson this turn dies, you gain 1 life and Axelrod deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: He is devious and cunning, in both appearance and deed. Beware the Warbeard, for this brute bites as well as he barks!
cards.name: Barktooth Warbeard

cards.flavor: Thundering down from Hammerheim, no foe could slow Bartel's charge.
cards.name: Bartel Runeaxe
cards.text:
Vigilance
Bartel Runeaxe can't be the target of Aura spells.

cards.name: Boris Devilboon
cards.text: {2}{B}{R}, {T}: Put a 1/1 black and red Demon creature token named Minor Demon onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Chromium
cards.text:
Flying
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Chromium unless you pay {W}{U}{B}.

cards.name: Gabriel Angelfire
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose flying, first strike, trample, or rampage 3. Gabriel Angelfire gains that ability until your next upkeep. (Whenever a creature with rampage 3 becomes blocked, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.flavor: Urborg became the final resting place of many swordsmen of renown, their steel outmatched by the wiles of Gwendlyn.
cards.name: Gwendlyn Di Corci
cards.text: {T}: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.flavor: Hail from Tolaria the ever changing 'Dane.
cards.name: Halfdane
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, change Halfdane's base power and toughness to the power and toughness of target creature other than Halfdane until the end of your next upkeep.

cards.name: Hazezon Tamar
cards.text:
When Hazezon Tamar enters the battlefield, put X 1/1 Sand Warrior creature tokens that are red, green, and white onto the battlefield at the beginning of your next upkeep, where X is the number of lands you control at that time.
When Hazezon leaves the battlefield, exile all Sand Warriors.

cards.flavor: "You would never guess, at the terrifying sight of the man, that Hunding was as charming a companion as one could wish for."
cards.name: Hunding Gjornersen
cards.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.flavor: Mightiest of the cat warriors, Jedit Ojanen forsook the forests of his tribe and took service with the Robaran Mercenaries, rising through their ranks to lead them in the battle for Efrava.
cards.name: Jedit Ojanen

cards.flavor: Once, the order of the Closed Fist reached throughout the Kb'Briann Highlands. Now, Jerrard alone remains to uphold their standard.
cards.name: Jerrard of the Closed Fist
Kei Takahashi
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Two of my Warriors found that the creature was dangerous not only in combat, but also in simple proximity."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.name: Kjeldoran Frostbeast
cards.text: At end of combat, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by Kjeldoran Frostbeast.

cards.name: Lady Caleria
cards.text: {T}: Lady Caleria deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor:
"When milady was young, the sight of a rainbow would fill her soul with peace. As she grew, she learned to share her rapture with others."
—Lady Gabriella
cards.name: Lady Evangela
cards.text: {W}{B}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.

cards.flavor:
"I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone."
—A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca
cards.name: Lady Orca

cards.flavor: Livonya's own nature is a matter of mystery. Nothing is known for sure, merely rumors of unearthly stealth, and unholy alliances.
cards.name: Livonya Silone
cards.text: First strike; legendary landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a legendary land.)

cards.flavor: Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
cards.name: Marhault Elsdragon
cards.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.name: Nebuchadnezzar
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Name a card. Target opponent reveals X cards at random from his or her hand. Then that player discards all cards with that name revealed this way. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nicol Bolas unless you pay {U}{B}{R}.
Whenever Nicol Bolas deals damage to an opponent, that player discards his or her hand.

cards.name: Palladia-Mors
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Palladia-Mors unless you pay {R}{G}{W}.

cards.flavor: We all know the legend: Pavel wanders the realms, helping those in greatest need. But is this a measure of his generosity, or of his obligation to atone?
cards.name: Pavel Maliki
cards.text: {B}{R}: Pavel Maliki gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Princess Lucrezia
cards.text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."
cards.name: Ragnar
cards.text: {G}{W}{U}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

cards.flavor: Ramirez DePietro is a most flamboyant pirate. Be careful not to believe his tall tales, especially when you ask his age.
cards.name: Ramirez DePietro
cards.text: First strike

cards.name: Ramses Overdark
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target enchanted creature.

cards.name: Rasputin Dreamweaver
cards.text:
Rasputin Dreamweaver enters the battlefield with seven dream counters on it.
Remove a dream counter from Rasputin: Add {1} to your mana pool.
Remove a dream counter from Rasputin: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rasputin this turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Rasputin started the turn untapped, put a dream counter on it.
Rasputin can't have more than seven dream counters on it.

cards.flavor: "Political violence is a perfectly legitimate answer to the persecution handed down by dignitaries of the state."
cards.name: Riven Turnbull
cards.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rohgahh of Kher Keep
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {R}{R}{R}. If you don't, tap Rohgahh of Kher Keep and all creatures named Kobolds of Kher Keep, then an opponent gains control of them.
Creatures you control named Kobolds of Kher Keep get +2/+2.

cards.name: Rubinia Soulsinger
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.

cards.flavor:
"Remember Sir Shandlar! Remember and stand firm!"
—rallying cry of the Eberyn militia
cards.name: Sir Shandlar of Eberyn

cards.flavor: Even the brave have cause to tremble at the sight of Sivitri Scarzam. Who else has tamed Scarzam's Dragon?
cards.name: Sivitri Scarzam

cards.flavor:
"What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn't know existed?"
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
cards.name: Spectral Shield
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can't be the target of spells.

cards.name: Stangg
cards.text: When Stangg enters the battlefield, put a legendary 3/4 red and green Human Warrior creature token named Stangg Twin onto the battlefield. When Stangg leaves the battlefield, exile that token. When that token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Stangg.

cards.flavor: Sunastian has roots in both sorcery and swordplay; he has learned never to depend too heavily on the latter.
cards.name: Sunastian Falconer
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tetsuo Umezawa
cards.text:
Tetsuo Umezawa can't be the target of Aura spells.
{U}{B}{B}{R}, {T}: Destroy target tapped or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: Her given name has been lost in the mists of time. Legend says that her silent vigil will one day be ended by the one who, pure of heart and spirit, calls out that name again.
cards.name: The Lady of the Mountain

cards.flavor: Administrator of the military state of Sheoltun, Tobias is the military right arm of the empire and the figurehead of its freedom.
cards.name: Tobias Andrion
Tor Wauki
cards.text: {T}: Tor Wauki deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: "How can you accuse me of evil? Though these deeds be unsavory, no one will argue: good shall follow from them."
cards.name: Torsten Von Ursus

cards.flavor: An explorer of the Æther, Tuknir often discovers himself in the most unusual physical realms.
cards.name: Tuknir Deathlock
cards.text:
Flying
{R}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Vaevictis Asmadi unless you pay {B}{R}{G}.
{B}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wandering Mage
cards.text:
{W}, Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
{U}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target Cleric or Wizard creature this turn.
{B}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target player this turn.

cards.flavor: A regular guest at the Royal Masquerade, Arien is the envy of the Court. She appears in a new costume every hour.
cards.name: Xira Arien
cards.text:
Flying
{B}{R}{G}, {T}: Target player draws a card.

cards.name: Arena of the Ancients
cards.text:
Legendary creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
When Arena of the Ancients enters the battlefield, tap all legendary creatures.

cards.name: Astrolabe
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Astrolabe: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.
cards.name: Barl's Cage
cards.text: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.

cards.flavor: After the Battle of Pitdown, Lady Ursnell fashioned the first such instrument out of Lord Ursnell's left leg.
cards.name: Bone Flute
cards.text: {2}, {T}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the fireball struck our front line."
—Lydia, Countess Brellis
cards.name: Coal Golem
cards.text: {3}, Sacrifice Coal Golem: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Play the song of he who delivered us. Play the song of Feroz."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
cards.name: Didgeridoo
cards.text: {3}: You may put a Minotaur permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, called the Pretender
cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.name: Gauntlets of Chaos
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice Gauntlets of Chaos: Exchange control of target artifact, creature, or land you control and target permanent an opponent controls that shares one of those types with it. If those permanents are exchanged this way, destroy all Auras attached to them.

cards.name: Illusionary Mask
cards.text: {X}: You may choose a creature card in your hand whose mana cost could be paid by some amount of, or all of, the mana you spent on {X}. If you do, you may cast that card face down as a 2/2 creature spell without paying its mana cost. If the creature that spell becomes as it resolves has not been turned face up and would assign or deal damage, be dealt damage, or become tapped, instead it's turned face up and assigns or deals damage, is dealt damage, or becomes tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Knowledge Vault
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library face down.
{0}: Sacrifice Knowledge Vault. If you do, discard your hand, then put all cards exiled with Knowledge Vault into their owner's hand.
When Knowledge Vault leaves the battlefield, put all cards exiled with Knowledge Vault into their owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Life Chisel
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Nova Pentacle
cards.text: {3}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature of an opponent's choice instead.

cards.flavor:
"Look deep into the Grail, and see there what you desire most."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
cards.name: Sol Grail
cards.text:
As Sol Grail enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sword of the Ages
cards.text:
Sword of the Ages enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Sword of the Ages and any number of creatures you control: Sword of the Ages deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the total power of the creatures sacrificed this way, then exile Sword of the Ages and those creature cards.

cards.name: Voodoo Doll
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a pin counter on Voodoo Doll.
At the beginning of your end step, if Voodoo Doll is untapped, destroy Voodoo Doll and it deals damage to you equal to the number of pin counters on it.
{X}{X}, {T}: Voodoo Doll deals damage equal to the number of pin counters on it to target creature or player. X is the number of pin counters on Voodoo Doll.

cards.name: Bayou
cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.)

cards.text: {T}: Draw two cards, then discard three cards.

cards.text:
{T}, Exile a creature you control: Put a storage counter on City of Shadows.
{T}: Add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the number of storage counters on City of Shadows.

—Emily Dickinson

cards.text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1}."

cards.flavor:
"Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"
